benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/pause - Pause a bundle

covered: Valid Request: PUT /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/pause updates bundle to paused state for valid inputs (TC01–TC05).
Non-Existing Resource: Proper handling with 404 for non-existent bundle (TC07) and 404 when database has no bundles (TC20).
Concurrency: Tests verify behavior under concurrent requests (TC21).
Authorization: Tests cover missing header (TC10) and unauthorized user (TC11).
Query Parameters: Validation and behavior for requestedDate and pluginProperty (TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC15, TC16, TC18, TC19).
Validation & Error Handling: Includes invalid bundleId formats (TC06), malformed/requestedDate (TC17, TC18), malformed pluginProperty (TC19), SQL/XSS injection tests (TC13, TC14).
Error Codes & Messages: Verifies 400/401/404/502/503 responses and error messages (TC06, TC07, TC08, TC10, TC11, TC12, TC25).
Regression & Isolation: Regression tests for unrelated bundles and data consistency (TC23, TC24–TC27).
Integration Dependency: 502 when dependent service is down (TC25).
Performance/Load: Load test scenarios with many bundles and rapid requests (TC22).
gaps: Rate limiting/throttling: No tests simulating burst traffic or throttling behavior.
Caching behavior: No tests validating caching headers or cache invalidation.
Partial Update: Not applicable for PUT; no tests for partial updates are present (acceptance tests cover full pause operation).
Empty payloads and duplicate submissions: No explicit tests for null payload or duplicate pause submissions.
Pagination: Not applicable for a single resource; no pagination tests for listing bundles.
recommendations: Add rate-limiting tests and verify throttling behavior under burst load.
Add tests for caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) on PUT responses if applicable.
Add tests for duplicate submissions and idempotency.
Add tests for null/malformed payload edge cases and confirm proper error responses.
Document and test for pagination if API expands to list endpoints; otherwise, keep as-is.
Consider separate test focusing on performance metrics under load with measurable thresholds.
